meanings.definition: The position or authority of a master.
meanings.sent1: In the kingdom, the masterships were respected and obeyed by all.
meanings.sent2: She worked hard to achieve the masterships in her field of expertise.
meanings.sent3: The cat claimed the masterships of the house, demanding treats and belly rubs.
meanings.sent4: His masterships over the chessboard were unmatched, always predicting his opponent's moves.
meanings.sent5: The masterships of the wise elder were evident in every decision made for the village.

meanings.definition: The skill or proficiency of a master.
meanings.sent1: His masterships in painting were displayed in the gallery for all to admire.
meanings.sent2: She honed her masterships in cooking through years of practice and experimentation.
meanings.sent3: The robot showed off its masterships in dancing, moving with precision and grace.
meanings.sent4: Her masterships in negotiation turned the difficult situation into a win-win scenario.
meanings.sent5: The masterships of the sculptor were evident in every delicate curve of the marble statue.

meanings.definition: The collective group of individuals who hold the position of master.
meanings.sent1: The masterships gathered for a meeting to discuss the future of the guild.
meanings.sent2: The masterships of the various crafts came together to share their knowledge.
meanings.sent3: The masterships of the council argued over the allocation of resources.
meanings.sent4: The masterships of the academy were renowned for their contributions to education.
meanings.sent5: The masterships of the team collaborated to achieve victory in the championship.
